CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| thienyl-substituted anthracene |
| low band-gap polymers |
| PTATDPP |
| various electron acceptor materials |

In this paragraph, "thienyl-substituted anthracene" and "PTATDPP" are the specific material names mentioned. "Low band-gap polymers" and "various electron acceptor materials" are not specific material names, but rather descriptions of types of materials.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| thienyl-substituted anthracene |
| PTATDPP |

In the paragraph, only "thienyl-substituted anthracene" and "PTATDPP" are explicitly identified as material names. Other entities such as "these results", "building block", "electron - donating unit", "high performance PSCs", "universal electron donor material", and "compatible with various electron acceptor materials" do not refer to specific material names.

Paragraph: These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| high performance PSCs |
| PTATDPP |
| universal electron donor material |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| thienyl-substituted anthracene (as a building block for electron donating units) |
| low band - gap polymers (as materials for high performance PSCs) |
| PTATDPP (as a universal electron donor material) |
| PSCs (as materials) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value               |
|-----------------------------|
| thienyl-substituted anthracene |
| electron - donating unit     |
| low band - gap polymers      |
| high performance PSCs        |
| PTATDPP                     |
| universal electron donor material |
| various electron acceptor materials |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value               |
|-----------------------------|
| thienyl-substituted anthracene |
| low band - gap polymers      |
| high performance PSCs        |
| PTATDPP                     |
| universal electron donor material |

Note: "electron donating unit" can be considered a property of the material, specifically referring to the ability of the material to donate electrons. Therefore, it is included in the table. However, "various electron acceptor materials" is not a property value, but rather a description of materials that can be used in conjunction with PTATDPP.
